Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

Node.gloss: to turn back from|to give up|to retire from
Node.definition: literally: to turn (from an activity); hence: = action by which humans or deities stop being engaged in a certain activity
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= a pattern of activities performed by a person or deity, with the primary focus on whether these activities are good or evil
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= indirect male progenitor
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= particle marking a proposition as contrastive, and so limiting the scope or impact of what was stated before
= a pattern of behavior required by somebody in authority
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

literally: to overtake; hence: = process by which events that humans have been expecting or dreading finally take place, ◄ as if they had been pursuing them for some time and ultimately caught up with them
= indirect male progenitor
literally: to turn; hence: = process by which humans or deities change their mind about a certain matter, ► which usually results in a different course of action

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= action by which deities or humans put together a plan or strategy to act on; often in a bad sense
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= a pattern of activities performed by a person or deity, with the primary focus on whether these activities are good or evil

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which a countable entity is four in number
= state in which a countable object is eleven or the eleventh in number
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= month, equivalent to period January/February; ► post exilic
= state in which a countable entity is two in number

= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a donkey (חֲמֹור) or a horse (סוּס) or in a chariot (מֶרְכָּבָה)

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= state in which an object is red or reddish in color
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= the area separating two or mores locations

= an evergreen tree or bush, up to 1.5 m. high; dark glossy leaves are dense on the branches, and the flowers are white or pink; the whole plant gives off an agreeable odor; ► used by the Jews in the Feast of Tabernacles; regarded as a desirable tree, as opposed to thorns and thistles
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= state in which an object is red or reddish in color
= state in which objects are white in color

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans to perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move through an area without a specific destination

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

= state in which there is no activity of a certain kind in a certain place
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to express one's anger|to vent one's anger
Node.definition: = action by which deities or humans give free expression to their anger regarding someone else
= state in which a countable entity is seventy in number
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which deities experience a desire to make humans feel relief after a time of grief

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

Node.gloss: to be zealous|to be wrought up|to be concerned for
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

= process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= process by which humans or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear, which can easily lead to carelessness and arrogance
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law
= pertaining to happening with a low intensity
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= line ► used for measuring the size of an object; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards

Node.gloss: to stretch out a measuring line
Node.definition: literally: to stretch out a measuring line (over something); hence: = action by which humans or deities determine the measurements of an area as part of a construction or demolition job
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
